item.title: There is no Bondage - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description: Swamiji, in this track, speaks about bondage and liberation. We are bound and this bondage has to be removed. The whole Ātma jñāna sādhana is meant for that. The Upanishads say the Ātma is eternally free. It has got no bondage at all. A seeker must understand the nature and character of the soul and know it to be sentient and spatial. Being so, it cannot court any bondage, any time. So, it is not the question of acquiring of liberation, but the understanding that there is no bondage. Understanding that there is no bondage, is true liberation. Shlokas chanted in the Track: गुणस्य माया मूलत्वान्न मे मोक्षो न बन्धनम् ।। Srimad Bhagavatam 11.11.1

item.title: Mind Can Dissolve All Mental Impacts - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description: In this audio, Swamiji points out that the skill and ability of the mind is limitless. Mind is capable of assimilating any kind of an impact from the world. The mind will dissolve only mental impacts and these impacts are made by the mind, not by any object. Mind alone sees the world. Mind alone forges an imprint on it and mind alone feels the impact. So, everything is the mind and mind alone is the sole focus of spiritual wisdom. The more assimilative the mind becomes, more the structure of the mind will change. The seeker must always strive to nurture and develop the mind. There are only two skills needed to live successfully in the world: 1) To assimilate all impacts from the world and 2) To generate all necessary outputs from the mind,

item.itunes:summary: In this audio, Swamiji points out that the skill and ability of the mind is limitless. Mind is capable of assimilating any kind of an impact from the world. The mind will dissolve only mental impacts and these impacts are made by the mind, not by any object. Mind alone sees the world. Mind alone forges an imprint on it and mind alone feels the impact. So, everything is the mind and mind alone is the sole focus of spiritual wisdom. The more assimilative the mind becomes, more the structure of the mind will change. The seeker must always strive to nurture and develop the mind. There are only two skills needed to live successfully in the world: 1) To assimilate all impacts from the world and 2) To generate all necessary outputs from the mind,

item.title: Four Levels of Activity - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description: Human activity is primarily in four levels, says Swamiji in this track. The first is the physical level where activity is performed with the body, limbs and sensory organs. Next is the oral activity where sounds are produced. Superior to these external activities is the mental activity where the thinking, remembering etc are done by the mind. Still higher and deeper is the activity done by the intelligence where there is a quest for knowledge. Swamiji exhorts all seekers to evaluate and understand the two inner activities–the activities performed by the mind and intelligence. They constitute the deepest and loftiest levels of activity which have a transforming effect on the personality of the seeker.

item.title: Mind and the Self - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description: In this message, Swamiji says that all actions are initiated by the mind, sustained by the mind and dissolved by the mind. So, mind is the sole focus of an individual’s life. Normally, the mind is outgoing. This outgoing tendency has to be avoided and the seeker must make an effort to rest the mind on the Self. When the mind rests on the Self, it will slowly give up desires for external objects. When the mind becomes free of external desires, the Self experience one has will not be limited to meditational hours but it will extend to all activities and interactions. Shlokas chanted in the Track: यथा यथा प्रत्यगवस्थितं मनः तथा तथा मुञ्चति बाह्यवासनाम् । निःशेषमोक्षे सति वासनानां आत्मानुभूतिः प्रतिबन्धशून्या ॥ (Vivekacūḍāmaṇiḥ 276)

item.title: Unaffected Nature of the Mind - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description: In this message, Swamiji urges seekers to understand that the focus of spirituality is the ‘Mind’. By any extent of mind’s productions, the mind substance is not affected. One has to sit and observe the mind and understand that any kind of a mental activity does not bring about a structural change in the mind. The mind presence continues to be the same. Remaining silent in oneself, one can feel the presence of the mind and realize that no function of the mind affects the mind itself. Realizing this unaffected nature of the mind, one must remain unaffected. The entire sadhana is to gain this wonderful position of enlightenment, stability and steadiness.

item.title: Make Light of All Situations - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description: In this audio, Swamiji exhorts all seekers to be at home with everything that happens in life. Maybe in the past sins or mistakes were committed but one should not worry about it. One must have a light mind. One must not magnify any troubles or irritations. Our mind has got full capacity to be at home with everything, either past, present, or future. It is the mind that has to reconcile with whatever has taken place or is going to take place. Our mind has got sufficient potential for that. One must have faith and remain unruffled. A seeker needs to keep developing the right knowledge, devotion and sublimity.

item.title: No Thought is besides and different from the Mind - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description: In this talk, Swamiji discusses and explains the three levels of Reality–Vyāvahārika (Interactional), Prātibhāsika (illusory) and Pāramārthika. All the three are there concurrently or parallel in us. When we are wakeful it is Vyāvahārika reality, when we are dreaming it is illusory reality, and when we are able to understand it fully it becomes the real reality. In the Vyāvahārika level things are different from us and plurality is there. In the dream, difference is there but it is in an illusory manner and when one understands the Truth in the level of the intelligence, he will find that all are but one and one alone is. Shlokas chanted in the Track: एकं रूपं बहुधा यः करोति (Kathopanishad 2.2.12)

item.title: Harmonizing the mind - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description: In this talk, Swamiji says that the body and the senses are inert. It has to be animated and activated by the mind and the intelligence. Our real personality is the mento-intellectual one. So, all the reformation, enrichment and refinement have to be brought about in the mind and the intelligence. A seeker wanting to have freedom and fulfilment, will have to improve and nourish the mind and intelligence. This refinement and enrichment cannot be had by any external rituals or practices. Shlokas chanted in the Track: मात्रास्पर्शास्तु कौन्तेय शीतोष्णसुखदुःखदाः । आगमापायिनोऽनित्यास्तांस्तितिक्षस्व भारत ॥ Bhagavad Gita २-१४॥ यं हि न व्यथयन्त्येते पुरुषं पुरुषर्षभ । समदुःखसुखं धीरं सोऽमृतत्वाय कल्पते ॥ Bhagavad Gita २-१५॥

item.title: World - A Mind Display - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description: In this message, Swamiji speaks about Hindu Dharma and the two personalities around whom it prevails. One is Sri Rama and the other is Sri Krishna. In Sri Rama’s life, we find that the greatness of the human mind consists in the sacrifice it is able to generate. Sri Krishna repeatedly emphasizes to Uddhava (In Srimad Bhagavatam) that the whole world is nothing but a display of the mind. The prime emphasis of his teaching is on the illusory nature of the world. Everything is the mind display, and mind itself is an expression of consciousness. This consciousness is the Supreme truth, and that alone is God.

item.title: The Growth of Mind and Intelligence - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description: In this track, Swamiji makes us understand that the body stops growing at the age of 21 and the mind and intelligence are the only faculties that need to grow after that. So, in human life, the sole focus has to be on the mind. Knowledge of the mind and intelligence and their function is the Subject Knowledge. In subject knowledge, we aim to enhance the skill, the ability, the performance of the mind and the intelligence. How to improve the mind and intelligence? The mind is nourished and improved, when we incorporate desirable qualities and eliminate undesirable qualities. To nourish the intelligence, one has to develop the art of introspection.

item.title: Culturing a Buoyant Mind - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description: In this talk, Poojya Swamiji takes up the subject of the potential of the mind. We all have things in our past which have the capacity to hurt or victimize us in the present. By the right thought process, by the right emotional process, by the right spiritual process, all that can be simply dropped and the mind can start becoming lustrous and brilliant. One is not to be victimized by the memory of the past; one has to be encouraged by the possibility of the present. Swamiji emphasizes that If one wants to get into the actual sādhanā, one has to penetrate into the mind. You can think, “Any kind of a past I have, I will simply dispossess it. I will develop and culture a new present, a new mind.”

item.title: Imbibe Qualities to Make Your Mind Flexible - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description: The entire spirituality is mind-centered, says Swamiji. One has to constantly try improving the mind, building and imbuing the mind with newer and newer qualities. When the mind cultivates qualties such as love, sympathy, sacrifice etc, it will become vast and expansive. Mind is currently inflexible and hard. The same mind can be made flexible, spatial, ready to assimiate all interactional impacts. Shlokas chanted in this audio: आकाशवल्लेपविदूरगोऽहं आदित्यवद्भास्यविलक्षणोऽहम् । अहार्यवन्नित्यविनिश्चलोऽहं अम्भोधिवत्पारविवर्जितोऽहम् ॥ Vivekachudamani–499

item.title: Sadhana for wholesomeness and fulfilment - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description:
Analyzing the inner personality, Swamiji explains that our personality consists of the mind, intelligence, ego and the substratum of all these–the SELF. With such a personality we are complete, full and wholesome. To understand that this is so and to make our mind and intelligence reflect the fullness and wholesomeness is the real effort and sādhanā.
We have to understand that the whole of spiritual sadhana is centered in the mind. It is the mind that begets experience, it is the mind that distorts matters, and it is the mind that becomes pure and brings clarity.
Shlokas chanted in the track:
मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय । निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः ।। Bhagavad Gita–12.8
PR 04 Jan 2013

item.title: Solution lies within - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description: In this track, Poojya Swamiji speaks on how a seeker should approach every challenge in life. One has to elevate oneself from emotional turbulence to rational enquiry–from the mind level to the intelligence level. For every problem, there is a solution right beneath the problem in the inner recess of the mind itself. If there is a problem, there is also a solution. If there is no solution, at least there is a dissolution of the problem. The whole process revolves around our own inner personality. Shlokas chanted in this track: कस्मिन्नु भगवो विज्ञाते सर्वमिदं विज्ञातं भवतीति ॥ kasminnu bhagavo vijñāte sarvamidaṃ vijñātaṃ bhavatīti || Mundakopanishad–1.1.3

item.title: The Thought is nothing but the Mind - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description: Mind is the cause of bondage and liberation, the scriptures state. What is the nature of the mind, and what is its relationship with thought? What leads to liberation? Poojya Swamiji explores these and other questions related to the mind in this short talk. Slokas chanted in the track मन एव मनुष्याणां कारणं बन्धमोक्षयोः । (Amritabindu Upanishad 2) न कश्चिज्जायते जीवः सम्भवोऽस्य न विद्यते । एतत्तदुत्तमं सत्यं यत्र किञ्चिन्न जायते ॥ (Gaudapada Karika 3.48) PR 12 May 2017

item.title: A Desireless Mind is Liberated - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description: Mind alone is the cause of bondage for human beings, the scriptures say. They go on to explain how a desireful mind is impure and a mind freed of desires is pure. The objective is to give up all desires and “do nothing”. That is the direction in which we need to move. Slokas chanted in the track मनो हि द्विविधं प्रोक्तं शुद्धं चाशुद्धमेव च । अशुद्धं कामसङ्कल्पं शुद्धं कामविवर्जितम् ॥ (Amritabindu Upanishad 1) न ह्यसन्न्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन ॥ (Bhagavad Gita 6.2) मन एव मनुष्याणां कारणं बन्धमोक्षयोः । बन्धाय विषयासक्तं मुक्त्यै निर्विषयं स्मृतम् ॥ (Amritabindu Upanishad 2) आत्मसंस्थं मनः कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् ॥ (Bhagavad Gita 6.25) PR 05 May 2018

item.title: The Law of the Mind - Prabhatha Rashmih
item.description: The mind has a wonderful quality. Whatever one thinks of, the mind becomes that. This is the foundation of infusional sadhana which Poojya Swamiji explains in detail. Slokas chanted in the track: मनसैव मनश्छित्त्वा कुठारेणेव पादपम् । पदं पावनमासाद्य सद्य एव स्थिरो भव ॥ (Yoga-Vasistha Ramayanam 5.13.35) या मतिः सा गतिर्भवेत् ॥ (Ashtavakra Samhita 11) चित्तं चिद्भक्षितं कृत्वा चित्तादपि परो भव ॥ (Yoga-Vasistha Ramayanam 5.111.18) PR 03 Jun 2018

item.title: Integrate the mind - Prabhatha Rashmih
item.description: In this audio, Swamiji emphsizes that a seeker has to understand that the first and the last factor to be dealt with is the mind. The problem is that we are not conscious of the fact that it is the mind that is to be handled. A seeker has to integrate mind’s own products and reactions. Any kind of a spiritual seeking and a spiritual effort will be an effort to look into the mind and make its reactions uniform, without swinging between likes and dislikes, loss and gain etc.

item.title: Mind is a Treasure - Prabhatha Rashmih
item.description: Just as there are physical, chemical and biological laws governing the physical universe, there are psychological, philosophical and spiritual laws working within us. As per these laws, everything is going on, one plan after another, events happen and become past. We have to be reconciled with whatever is and will be. We must realize that our mind is something very beautiful, splendid, a treasure. It is our greatest friend, not our enemy. PR 03 Nov 2013

item.title: Seeing Atma Everywhere
item.description: In this sublime talk, Nutan Swamiji brings home the essential truth that every perception, every experience gives us the touch of the Supreme Presence. Although the world is full of variety, when it comes to our experience within, all of it is experienced as Consciousness alone. Ruminating and actualizing this knowledge, will bring about a great transformation in our attitude towards life!

item.title: Offering all activities to God
item.description: All of us worship God, in our own ways. But is that worship reaching God? What constitutes a real worship? Is worship only a time and space bound activity? Or does it have much larger application? In this enlightening talk, Ma answers all these questions and gives us a clear understanding of true worship.

item.title: Be contented with whatever chance brings - Prabhatha Rashmih
item.description: Is not our entire life providence-driven? Knowing this, let us train our mind to be contented with what it has and gets. Poojya Swamiji explains to us the secret of contentment and fulfillment in life. Slokas chanted in the track यदृच्छालाभसन्तुष्टो द्वन्द्वातीतो विमत्सरः । समः सिद्धावसिद्धौ च कृत्वापि न निबध्यते ॥ (Bhagavad Gita 4.22) PR 12 May 2018

item.title: Be connected to the source of all thoughts - Prabhatha Rashmih
item.description: Apart from the world of five elements, we have only mind, intelligence and ego. While at the bodily level, the possibility of changes is limited, at the mental level, the options are infinite. One way to bring about those changes, that Swamiji speaks about, is to remain connected to the source of all thoughts. Slokas chanted in the track: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च । अहङ्कार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिकष्टधा ॥ (Bhagavad Gita 7.4) PR 08 Aug 2016

item.description: The cheerfulness and joy of the mind are lost because of the desire and possessiveness. Dropping the latter will make the mind pure and consequently vibrant. Slokas chanted in the track: प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम् । उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम् ॥ (Bhagavad Gita 6.27) PR 02 Jan 2016

item.title: Making the Mind a Treasure - Prabhatha Rashmih
item.description: All the interactions proceed from the mind, and the impacts are felt by the mind. Mind is the seat of all thoughts, emotions, feelings of happiness and unhappiness, etc. Such being the case, it is the mind alone which has to be made beautiful, sublime, placid and serene. The whole spirituality is nothing but an effort to improve and strengthen the mind. PR 2 Apr 2015

item.title: Be Conscious of your Mind - Prabhatha Rashmih
item.description: One must be conscious of one’s mind because it is only the mind that gives us the notion of the world, notion of oneself and notion of everything. Out of the stored memories, mind produces thoughts, some desirable, some not. How do we get away from the obsession of thoughts? In this talk, Swamiji tells us the way.

item.title: The Middle Position - Prabhatha Rashmih
item.description: Quoting a verse from Adi Shankaracharya’s Vivekachudamani, Poojya Swamiji speaks about the interactive life of a Self-Realized person. His will be a public life, he would meet and interact with many people, places and situations. In all his interactions, he neither gets attached to anything nor does he get detached from anything. He is established in the middle position. Swamiji exhorts listerners to stay focussed on the middle position. This middle position, self-postion, is so beautiful that one starts becoming harmonious with the world, integral with the world. Our spiritual attainment is not something to be had by being away from the world but by practicing ‘away-ness’ in the world itself. Shlokas chanted in the audio: न खिद्यते नो विषयैः प्रमोदते न सज्जते नापि विरज्यते च । स्वस्मिन्सदा क्रीडति नन्दति स्वयं निरन्तरानन्दरसेन तृप्तः ।। (Vivekacūḍāmaṇiḥ 536)

item.title: Sanatana Dharma
item.description: What is Sanatana Dharma? What is its meaning and purpose? Poojya Swamiji in his usual rational and eloquent manner explains the much-debated subject. Swamiji elucidates that Sanatana Dharma is an eternal power of sustenance, understanding and pursuing which, anyone can derive the necessary poise, freedom, welfare and strength to face any situation in life and realize one’s eternal nature.

item.title: Seek Contentment from the Mind Alone - Prabhatha Rashmih
item.description: It is foolishness to think that any object can create joy. Is joy not an inner creation of the mind alone? If we churn our mind with this knowledge, then undue elation and undue depression will both fled, and the contentment we seek, becomes ours. Slokas chanted in the track: मात्रास्पर्शास्तु कौन्तेय शीतोष्णसुखदुःखदाः । आगमापायिनोऽनित्यास्तांस्तितिक्षस्व भारत ।। (Bhagavad Gita 2.14) इन्द्रियस्येन्द्रियस्यार्थे रागद्वेषौ व्यवस्थितौ । तयोर्न वशमागच्छेत्तौ ह्यस्य परिपन्थिनौ ।। (Bhagavad Gita 3.34) न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्राप्य चाप्रियम् । स्थिरबुद्धिरसम्मूढो ब्रह्मविद् ब्रह्मणि स्थितः ।। (Bhagavad Gita 5.20) कामक्रोधवियुक्तानां यतीनां यतचेतसाम् । अभितो ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं वर्तते विदितात्मनाम् ।। (Bhagavad Gita 5.26)

item.title: What is Growth for a Spiritual Seeker? - Prabhata Rashmih
item.description:
In this talk, Poojya Swamiji tells us about a seeker’s growth in life. The seeker must look for an inner felicity growth, and such a growth happens in the mind and the intelligence. Of the many virtues that elevate a seeker on the way are love, sympathy and sacrifice. What is the final point of such a growth? Swamiji explains it is a total purity in the being, and a supreme peace and quietude.

Slokas chanted in the track
मुक्तिमिच्छसि चेत्तात विषयान् विषवत्त्यज।
क्षमार्जवदयातोषसत्यं पीयूषवद्भज॥
(Ashtāvakra Samhitā 1.2)
विशुद्धसत्त्वस्य गुणाः प्रसादः
स्वात्मानुभूतिः परमा प्रशान्तिः ।
तृप्तिः प्रहर्षः परमात्मनिष्ठा
यया सदानन्दरसं समृच्छति॥
(Vivekachudamani 119)

item.title: Peace, Joy and Fulfillment - Prabhata Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description:
In this audio, Swamiji explains how to practice the Sadhana of attaining peace, joy and fulfilment.

This sadhana of enriching the mind and intelligence will make the mind better and the intelligence sharper and more subtle. With qualitative thinking and introspection, the inner personality gets transformed and the whole life becomes peaceful, joyous and fulfilled.

item.title: Find Joy In Everything You Do - Prabhata Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description:
In this short message, Swamiji asks the listeners to do all activities joyfully. When one has this attitude towards work, one will go closer to the Ultimate knowledge. The activities maybe in the domestic, professional or the social field but one must make all activities spiritual and divine.

The formula is to drop all aspirations, desires, ideals and values and focus on doing all activities joyfully, happily.

Shlokas chanted in the audio:
ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं
(Bhagavad Gita 13.17)
यया संलभते रतिम्
(Srimad Bhagavatam 7.7.33)
तद्विद्धि प्रणिपातेन परिप्रश्नेन सेवया ।
उपदेक्ष्यन्ति ते ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनस्तत्त्वदर्शिनः ।।
(Bhagavad Gita 4.34)

Shlokas chanted in the audio:
ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं
(Bhagavad Gita 13.17)
यया संलभते रतिम्
(Srimad Bhagavatam 7.7.33)
तद्विद्धि प्रणिपातेन परिप्रश्नेन सेवया ।
उपदेक्ष्यन्ति ते ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनस्तत्त्वदर्शिनः ।।
(Bhagavad Gita 4.34)

item.title: Desire constricts the mind, it is bondage itself - Prabhata Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description:
Desires are the the blocks in the path of liberation. By desiring, the mind is constricted and the constricted mind will never deliver the peace we want. Absence of desires is liberation itself.

Slokas chanted in the track
बद्धो हि वासनाबद्धो मोक्षः स्यात् वासनाक्षयः ।
(Yoga-vasistha Ramayana 4.57.19)
ज्ञाते वस्तुन्यपि बलवती वासनाऽनादिरेषा
कर्ता भोक्ताप्यहमिति दृढा याऽस्य संसारहेतुः ।
(Vivekachudamani 267)

item.title: What is Liberation? - Prabhata Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha
item.description:
Poojya Swamiji gives the listener a fresh insight into the subject of liberation. When one is free, light and unaffected, it is liberation. Liberation does not mean that one has to get liberated. Liberation is in feeling that the ‘I’ in me has been ever-liberated. One has to feel one’s own liberated nature. It is not to attain any particular state but to know what is already there. Quoting a verse from Srimad Bhagavatam, Swamiji explains that terms like bondage and liberation are only in the realm of Gunas. But Gunas being illusory in nature, bondage and liberation are also illusory. Verses chanted in the talk:
बद्धो मुक्त इति व्याख्या गुणतो मे न वस्तुत: । गुणस्य मायामूलत्वान्न मे मोक्षो न बन्धनम् ॥
Srimad Bhagavatam–11.11.1

item.title: <![CDATA[Finding a Way through this Complex Life - Prabhatha Rashmih | Swami Bhoomananda Tirtha]]>
item.description:
<![CDATA[The human mind is a complex medley of traits and qualities. The society is complex, and we have to live in it. There will be the gravest of conflicts and contradictions. Swamiji says that being the case, we cannot be held responsible for the present plight, but we are certainly responsible to handle it and go forward. What is the way?
Slokas chanted in the track
सञ्जयोऽहं महाराज नमस्ते भरतर्षभ (Mahabharata, Bheeshma Parva, 14.3)
हतो भीष्म: शिखण्डिना (Mahabharata, Bheeshma Parva, 15.1)
धर्मादधर्मो बलवान्सम्प्राप्त इति मे मतिः । (Mahabharata, Bheeshma Parva, 15.42)
एतदार्येण कर्तव्यं कृच्छ्रास्वापत्सु सञ्जय । (Mahabharata, Bheeshma Parva, 15.62)
दारुणः क्षत्रधर्मोऽयमृषिभिः सम्प्रदर्शितः । (Mahabharata, Bheeshma Parva, 15.60)
धृतराष्ट्र उवाच – धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सव: । मामका: पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत संजय ॥ (Bhagavad Gita 1.1)
PR 04 Jun 2013]]>
